description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cirl3","text":"PNGase F is the most effective enzymatic method for removing almost all N-linked oligosaccharides from glycoproteins. PNGase F is an amidase, which cleaves between the innermost GlcNAc and asparagine residues of high mannose, hybrid, and complex oligosaccharides. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":72,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjgc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da39t","text":"This is a generic PNGase F protocol for non-denaturing reaction conditions. It is appropriate for both P0704 and P0708.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":103,"length":5},{"key":1,"offset":113,"length":5}],"data":{}},{"key":"a88ap","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12aub","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d5s79","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"2C4A15C8BD1B47CBAE1761E47E639F9C","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/p0704-pngase-f"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3E36AB1F691A4B06BBFC228963B66C74","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/p0708-pngase-f-recombinant"}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E489AA80C61D11EA9DC02D91AF9F9BF0","height":343,"id":211507,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gqtx9nan.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gqtv9nan.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gqtw9nan.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gqtu9nan.webp","width":550}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"9t7ma","text":"If using P0704/P0708, we recommend limiting PNGase F to 1/10 (or less) of the total reaction volume to keep the final glycerol concentration equal to (or less than) 5%.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":5},{"key":1,"offset":15,"length":5}],"data":{}},{"key":"9da27","text":"For unit conversion between different suppliers, please reference the Glycobiology Unit Conversion Chart page.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":70,"length":34}],"data":{}},{"key":"79r0u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43eqr","text":"Biology Unit Conversion Chart","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aljsg","text":"Reagent companies differ in how a unit of enzyme is defined. This chart can be used to help determine how a unit of enzyme from one company compares to a unit of enzyme from NEB. {"blocks":[{"key":"bue41","text":"Analyze by method of choice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sslp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"edu1p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":108,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"g9iv","text":"Note: The simplest method of assessing the extent of deglycosylation is by mobility shifts on SDS-PAGE gels.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
